title.value: Non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation in light of muon anomalous magnetic moment and long-baseline neutrino oscillation data
title.justification: It precisely reflects the topic and scope of the paper.
title.quote: Non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation in light of muon anomalous magnetic moment and long-baseline neutrino oscillation data.

extractions.description: The paper investigates the possibility of Lorentz invariance violation as a potential explanation for the recent tension observed in long-baseline neutrino oscillation experiments, specifically T2K and NOvA. The study explores both isotropic and non-isotropic Lorentz invariance violations in dimensions D = 4, 5, and 6, and examines their effects on neutrino oscillation data and the anomalous muon magnetic moment.

type.justification: The paper involves numerical analysis and empirical investigation of neutrino oscillation data and muon g-2 measurements.
type.quote: In this work, we study the prospects of uncovering LIV physics in neutrino oscillation experiments.

name.justification: The paper leverages numerical analysis and mathematical models within the context of particle physics and neutrino experiments.
name.quote: In the present work, we focus on the analysis of the neutrino oscillation data from the presently running Tokai-to-Kamioka (T2K) and NuMI Off-axis νe Appearance (NOνA) experiments.

name.justification: The research specifically addresses testing the Lorentz invariance violation in the context of neutrino oscillation and anomalous muon magnetic moment measurements.
name.quote: The analysis highlights the possibility of simultaneous relaxation of experimental tensions with Lorentz invariance violation of mixed nature.

name.justification: The T2K experiment data is used for numerical analysis in the study.
name.quote: In this work, we analyse the neutrino data that has been collected in the first phase of T2K between years 2009 and 2018.

name.justification: The NOvA experiment data is used for numerical analysis in the study.
name.quote: The neutrino and antineutrino data analyzed in this work is based on the events that were collected in NOνA far detector in 2014-2020.

name.justification: GLoBES is used for the numerical analysis of the T2K and NOvA data.
name.quote: The numerical analysis conducted in this work is done with General Long Baseline Experiment Simulator (GLoBES).
